description:
**Problem Statement:** You are given a 0-indexed integer array nums of even length, and an empty array arr. Alice and Bob decide to play a game with the following rules: In every round, Alice removes the minimum element from nums, and then Bob does the same.
Bob appends the removed element to the array arr, and then Alice does the same.
The game continues until nums becomes empty.
Return the resulting array arr. ### `Input Format:` ``` An array nums of even length (1 <= nums.length <= 100).
Each element in nums is an integer (1 <= nums[i] <= 100).
nums.length is guaranteed to be even. ``` ### `Output Format:` `An array arr containing the elements removed during the game.` ### `Example` #### `Input:` `nums = [5,4,2,3]` #### `Output:` `[3,2,5,4]` #### `Explanation: ` ``` In round one, first Alice removes 2 and then Bob removes 3. Then in arr, firstly Bob appends 3 and then Alice appends 2. So arr = [3,2]. At the beginning of round two, nums = [5,4]. Now, first Alice removes 4 and then Bob removes 5. Then both append in arr, which becomes [3,2,5,4]. ```
title: Two Minimum at a time

class Solution {
    public ArrayList<Integer> numberGame(ArrayList<Integer> nums) {
